intro: Tapeinoglossum nannodes, commonly known as the small-leaved tapeinoglossum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and umbel-like inflorescence composed of tiny white flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
